data.heading: Scope
data.text:
The management of electronic transport regulations (METR) [SOURCE: ISO 24315-1:2024, 3.3.2.3] provides trustworthy, authoritative, machine-interpretable, transport-related rules for using the road network.

The scope of METR includes both rules that are relatively static (e.g., static speed limits) as well as those that are dynamic (e.g., variable speed limits, lane closures at incident scenes). However, where appropriate, METR is expected to incorporate existing standards (e.g., ISO/TS 19091 for signalized intersections).

The scope of METR includes the networks for pedestrians, public-area mobile robots (PMRs), micromobility vehicles, and motor vehicles.

This document defines the requirements for a METR component system that is responsible for distributing electronic versions of transport-related rules to METR user systems (which are defined in ISO 24315-6). The transport-related rules to be distributed are signed and provided by the regulation system (per the requirements contained in ISO 24315-4). This document is presented in a format that is consistent with the guidance provided by ISO 29148 [2] for a system requirements document. 

For an understanding of how the METR distribution system fits into the larger METR system of systems, see ISO 24315-3. The operational concept for METR is provided in ISO 24315-2.

attributesChanged.text:
The management of electronic transport regulations (METR) provides trustworthy, authoritative, machine-interpretable, transport-related rules for using surface transport facilities.

The scope of METR includes both rules that are relatively static (e.g., static speed limits) as well as those that are dynamic (e.g., variable speed limits, lane closures at incident scenes). However, where appropriate, METR is expected to incorporate existing standards (e.g., ISO/TS 19091 for signalized intersections).

This document defines the system requirements for a METR distribution system in a format that is consistent with the guidance provided by ISO 29148 [2] for a system requirements document. For an understanding of how the METR distribution system fits into the larger METR system of systems, see ISO 24315-2.

These references will be removed in the final text. Text demarked with double asterisks ("**") are editorial notes that will be removed from the final draft. **

data.heading: Normative references
data.text: The following documents are referred to in the text in such a way that some, or all, of their content constitutes requirements of this document. For dated references, only the edition cited applies. For undated references, the latest edition of the referenced document (including any amendments) applies.

children.text: ISO/TS 14812, Intelligent transport systems — Vocabulary
ISO/TS 24315-1, Intelligent transport systems — Management of electronic traffic regulations (METR) — Part 1: Vocabulary
ISO/IEC/IEEE 24765, Systems and software engineering — Vocabulary

data.heading: Terms and definitions
data.text:
For the purposes of this document, the terms and definitions given in ISO/IEC/IEEE 24765, ISO/TS 14812 and ISO 24315-1 apply.

ISO and IEC maintain terminology databases for use in standardization at the following addresses:

•   ISO Online browsing platform: available at https://www.iso.org/obp

•   IEC Electropedia: available at https://www.electropedia.org

This document does not place requirements on external interfaces, but it does identify the external interfaces that are expected to exist per the ConOps. In these cases, it uses a "should" statement rather than a "shall" statement.

children.heading: Overview
children.text:
Distribution systems can be classified as either:

- Centre-based distribution systems, which perform the collector and disseminator roles as defined in the SoSR; or

 - a localized distribution system (hosted in a CV RSE or SV OBE), which perform the disseminator role as defined in the SoSR while relying upon its management system to perform the collector role.

A physical view diagram focused on the distribution system is provided in Figure 1.

attributesChanged.text:

 - RSE and Vehicle OBE-based distribution systems, which perform the disseminator role as defined in the SoSR while relying upon its management system to perform the collector role.

 - a localized distribution system (hosted in a CV RSE or SV OBE), which perform the disseminator role as defined in the SoSR while relying upon its management system to perform the collector role.

children.heading: Conventions
children.text: This document does not place requirements on external interfaces, but it does identify the external interfaces that are expected to exist per the ConOps. In these cases, it uses a "should" statement rather than a "shall" statement.

children.heading: General
children.text: The MRS requirements are presented based the order of input requirements, output requirements, functional requirements, (other) general requirements, and METR information requirements. The input and output requirements are organized by information flow, each with the following subclauses:
Definition: provides a reference to the clause in ISO 24315-3 that defines the purpose and contents of the information flow;
Source or Destination: identifies the intended source of the input flow or the destination of the output flow;
Causality: identifies the event that initiates the flow;
Constraints: identifies any constraints that apply to the flow; this can include filtering criteria, performance requirements, etc.; and
Resulting action: identifies the action that is to occur upon the completion of the flow.

children.heading: Information flow: Component status
children.text: The METR distribution system shall monitor the operational status of each external system, including each of its components, that the METR distribution system relies upon.

attributesChanged.text:
The METR distribution system shall make its operational status available to authorized external systems.

EXAMPLE  A map update system can include a service monitor that monitors the status of its source distribution systems so that it becomes aware of any distribution systems that are currently offline. See SU10: Center Maintenance service package in ARC-IT for more information.

The METR distribution system shall monitor the operational status of each external system that it uses as a source of data.

EXAMPLE  A distribution system monitors the status of each translation system that it uses as a source to detect when systems go offline, which can  eventually compromise the trustworthiness of data. See SU10: Center Maintenance service package in ARC-IT for more information.

The METR distribution system shall monitor the operational status of each external system, including each of its components, that the METR distribution system relies upon.

EXAMPLE 1: A distribution system monitors the status of each translation system that it uses as a source to detect when systems go offline, which can  eventually compromise the trustworthiness of data. See SU10: Center Maintenance service package in ARC-IT for more information.

EXAMPLE 2: A distribution system monitors the status of a traffic management system, which monitors the status of multiple RSEs that act as METR distribution systems for ad-hoc rules.

The METR distribution system shall monitor the operational status of each external system, including each of its components, that the METR distribution system relies upon.

EXAMPLE 2: A distribution system indirectly monitors the status of multiple METR distribution systems for ad-hoc rules and supplemental data provider systems (e.g., RSEs) via their managing traffic management system.

children.heading: Source identification
children.text: The METR distribution system shall obtain the “METR information” flow from one or more translation systems.

children.heading: Causality
children.text: For each translation system that the METR distribution system uses as a source, the distribution system shall subscribe for the “METR information” flow.

children.heading: Location constraint
children.text: The METR distribution system shall be able to specify geographic area criteria for its “METR information” flow.

children.heading: Constraints based on characteristics
children.text: The METR distribution system shall be able to specify appropriate relevancy criteria for its “METR information” flow to indicate the scope of its services, including:
manually implemented vehicle characteristics (e.g. addition of a trailer)
static vehicle characteristics;
user characteristics;
(others as deemed appropriate in req’ts phase)

children.heading: Verify information
children.text: The METR distribution system shall perform verification checks on the received METR information.

children.heading: Information flow: Component status
children.text: The METR distribution system shall make its operational status and the operational status of all of its source components available to authorized external systems.

children.heading: Information flow: METR status information
children.text: Upon request from a user system, the METR distribution system shall provide information regarding locations that have degraded operations.

attributesChanged.text:
Upon request from an on-board system, the METR user system shall obtain information regarding locations that have degraded operations.

NOTE 1: Degraded operations occur when the distribution system is unable to provide rules that are not nearing their expiration times.

Upon request from a user system, the METR distribution system shall provide information regarding locations that have degraded operations.

NOTE 1: Degraded operations occur when the distribution system is unable to provide rules that are not nearing their expiration times.

children.heading: Information flow: METR information for consumers
children.text: includes information about known inconsistencies

attributesChanged.text: The METR distribution system shall provide authorized requesting systems with all relevant rules that are available for distribution and that meet the requesting system's criteria.

children.heading: Information content
children.text: The “METR information for users” flow shall include:
relevant rules and meta-data;
the boundaries of each relevant sub-area;
jurisdictional vocabulary

children.heading: Destination identification
children.text: The METR distribution system shall participate in the “METR information for users” flow for any authorized METR user systems that initiate the flow.

children.heading: Causality
children.text: The METR distribution system shall wait for a METR user system to initiate the flow.

children.heading: Location constraints
children.text: The METR distribution system shall filter the METR information provided to each METR user system based on the location criteria established by that METR user system, including constraints defined by:
proximity from a point location;
proximity along a route;
geofenced area.

children.heading: Constraints based on characteristics
children.text: The METR distribution system shall filter the METR information provided to each METR user system base on the relevancy criteria established by that METR users:
manually implemented vehicle characteristics (e.g. addition of a trailer)
static vehicle characteristics;
user characteristics;
(others as deemed appropriate in req’ts phase)

children.heading: Performance requirement for requests
children.text: The METR distribution system shall respond to the “METR information for users” within the distributionResponseTime.

children.heading: Performance requirement for subscription
children.text: The METR distribution system shall provide updates to subscribing METR user systems for the “METR information for users” flow within the subscriptionRefreshTime of new information becoming available.

children.heading: Priority delivery
children.text: The METR distribution system shall deliver rules based on the priority assigned to each METR information item by the translator system.

children.heading: General
children.text: The METR distribution system shall provide authorized requesting systems with all relevant METR information that is available for distribution and that meets the requesting system's criteria.

attributesChanged.text: The METR distribution system shall provide authorized requesting systems with all relevant rules that are available for distribution and that meet the requesting system's criteria.

children.heading: One-time request performance requirement
children.text: In the case of a one-time request, the METR distribution system shall begin its response within the distributionResponseTime after the receipt of the request.

attributesChanged.text: When enacting this information flow, the METR distribution system shall provide external systems with all relevant rules that are known for each relevant jurisdictional area based on the criteria defined by the external system.
In the case of a one-time request, the METR distribution system shall begin its response within the ruleDistributionResponseTime after the receipt of the request.

children.heading: Subscription performance requirement
children.text: In the case of a subscription, the METR distribution system shall provide any newly available rule to the requesting system within the subscriptionRefreshTime after the rule becomes available for distribution.

attributesChanged.text: In the case of a subscription, the METR distribution system shall provide any newly available rule to the requesting system within the ruleUpdateResponseTime after the rule becomes available for distribution.

In the case of a subscription, the METR distribution system shall provide any newly available rule to the requesting system within the ruleSubscriptionRefreshTime after the rule becomes available for distribution.

children.heading: Priority delivery
children.text: The METR distribution system shall deliver rules based on the priority assigned to each METR information item by the translator system and the criteria established by the user's request.

children.heading: Information flow: Object registration
children.text: The METR distribution system shall register the following information with a discovery service such that METR user systems can determine if the services are relevant to their needs.

attributesChanged.text: The METR discrepancy handler system shall register the following information with a discovery service such that METR user systems can determine if the services are relevant to their needs.

children.text: type of service offered (i.e., METR distribution service)

attributesChanged.text: type of service offered (i.e., discrepancy reporting)

children.text: network address
transport network(s) supported (e.g., motor vehicle road network)
geographic area supported
terms of service

children.heading: Information flow: System-generated discrepancy report
children.text: The METR distribution system shall notify the associated translation system of any potential inconsistency detected during its verification process.

attributesChanged.heading: Report inconsistencies to translators
attributesChanged.text: The METR collection functional object shall notify the associated translation functional object(s) of any conflict or potential inconsistency detected during the verification process.
The METR distribution system shall notify the associated translation system of any potential inconsistency detected during the verification process.

children.heading: Information flow: Provide terms of service
children.text: Upon request for METR services that references an outdated terms of service, the METR distribution system shall provide the current terms of service to the requesting METR user system.

attributesChanged.heading: Maintain awareness of terms of service
attributesChanged.text: Upon request, the METR network shall provide the current terms of service to METR users.
Upon request, the METR distribution system shall provide the current terms of service to METR user systems.
Upon request for METR services that references an outdated terms of service, the METR distribution system shall provide the current terms of service to the requesting METR user system.

Upon request for METR services that references an outdated terms of service, the METR distribution system shall provide the current terms of service to the requesting METR user system.

NOTE: Within the scope of this document, the terms of service are limited to any restrictions on the use of data, the definition of the service boundaries, the level of guarantee for the provision of complete data, and a privacy statement.

children.text: Within the scope of this document, the terms of service are limited to any restrictions on the use of data, the definition of the service boundaries, the level of guarantee for the provision of complete data, and a privacy statement.

children.heading: Verification process
children.text: The METR distribution system shall perform verification checks on the collected information, including:

attributesChanged.text: The METR translation functional object should perform validation checks and provide warnings for any suspect data.

attributesChanged.heading: Rule validation
attributesChanged.text: The METR collection functional object should perform validation checks and provide warnings for any suspect data.
The METR collection functional object should perform verification checks on the collected rules, including the following:
The METR collection functional object should perform verification checks on the collected rules, including:
The METR collection functional object shall perform verification checks on the collected rules, including:
The METR distribution system shall perform verification checks on the collected rules, including:

children.text: verifying that each rule does not create any potential inconsistency issue (e.g., with any vocabulary term or other known rule);
children.title: Rule inconsistency

attributesChanged.text: verifying that the
verifying that the rule does not create any conflicts or inconsistencies with other known rules;
verifying that any rule that conflicts or has potential inconsistencies with other known rules is flagged as having a known issue;
verifying that any rule that has potential inconsistencies with vocabulary or other known rules is flagged as having a known issue;
verifying that each rule does not create any potential inconsistency (e.g., with vocabulary or other known rules is flagged as having a known issue;

children.text: verifying that vocabulary term definitions do not create any potential inconsistency issue (e.g., different definitions for same term from two translators representing same jurisdiction);
children.title: Term inconsistency

attributesChanged.text: verifying that vocabulary term definitions do not conflict (e.g., different definitions for same term from two translators representing same jurisdiction);

children.text: verifying that the boundaries of defined areas do not create any inconsistency;
children.title: Boundary inconsistency

attributesChanged.text: verifying that the boundaries of defined areas do not conflict;

children.text: verifying that terminated rules have been removed;
children.title: Rule termination

children.text: verifying that any duplicate rules are removed;
children.title: Duplicate rules

attributesChanged.text: verifying that duplicate rules are removed;

children.text: verifying that old versions of updated rules (i.e., with the same identifier) are removed;
children.title: Updated rules

attributesChanged.text: verifying that old versions of updated rules are removed;
verifying that old versions of updated rules (are removed;

children.heading: Performance requirement
children.text: The METR distribution system shall make all verified METR information available to "METR information for users” flows within the distributionVerificationTime from the receipt of information from the “METR information” flow.

children.heading: Efficient data exchange
children.text: The METR distribution system shall provide information in a format that is appropriately efficient to be transmitted across mobile wireless links.

children.heading: Radio frequency regulations
children.text: The METR distribution system shall comply with local regulations for the use of radio frequencies.

attributesChanged.text: The METR network shall comply with local regulations for the use of radio frequencies.

children.heading: Rule management application info
children.text: The METR distribution system shall distribute rules based on the configuration it receives from authorized managers.

attributesChanged.heading: Transport rules
attributesChanged.text:
The METR distribution system shall update its relevant rules from relevant translation systems within the ruleTranslationUpdateFrequency.

NOTE: This requirement can apply to both pre-announced and ad-hoc rules.

The METR distribution system shall update the rules it distributes based on the configuration it receives from authorized managers.

NOTE: This requirement can apply to both pre-announced and ad-hoc rules.
The METR distribution system shall update the rules it distributes based on the configuration it receives from authorized managers.
The METR distribution system shall update the ad-hoc rules it distributes based on the configuration it receives from authorized managers.

The METR distribution system shall update the ad-hoc rules it distributes based on the configuration it receives from authorized managers.

NOTE: The rule management application info flow is specific to RSE-based distribution systems, which typically only deal with distributing ad-hoc rules.

The METR distribution system shall distribute rules based on the configuration it receives from authorized managers.

NOTE: The rule management application info flow is specific to RSE-based distribution systems, which typically only deal with distributing ad-hoc rules.

children.text: The rule management application info flow is specific to RSE-based distribution systems, which typically only deal with distributing ad-hoc rules.

children.heading: Ad-hoc rule management info
children.text: The METR distribution system shall distribute rules based on the configuration it receives from authorized managers.

attributesChanged.text:
The METR distribution system shall update the ad-hoc rules it distributes based on the configuration it receives from authorized managers.

NOTE: The rule management application info flow is specific to RSE-based distribution systems, which typically only deal with distributing ad-hoc rules.

The METR distribution system shall manage the ad-hoc rules it distributes based on the configuration it receives from authorized managers.

NOTE: The rule management application info flow is specific to RSE-based distribution systems, which typically only deal with distributing ad-hoc rules.

The METR distribution system shall distribute rules based on the configuration it receives from authorized managers.

NOTE: The ad-hoc rule management flow is specific to Vehicle OBE-based distribution systems (e.g., EV OBE), which typically only distribute ad-hoc rules.

children.text: The ad-hoc rule management flow is specific to Vehicle OBE-based distribution systems (e.g., EV OBE), which typically only distribute ad-hoc rules.

children.heading: Ad-hoc rule information for users
children.text: The METR distribution system shall publicize ad-hoc rules and real-time rule updates using at least one communication technology (with associated parameters) identified within the rule catalogue for the relevant area.

attributesChanged.text: The METR distribution system shall publicize ad-hoc rules using the
The METR distribution system shall publicize ad-hoc rules using the communication technology and parameters identified within the rule catalogue for the relevant area.
The METR distribution system shall publicize ad-hoc rules using at least one communication technology (with associated parameters) identified within the rule catalogue for the relevant area.
The METR distribution system shall publicize ad-hoc rules using at least one communication technology (with associated parameters) identified within the rule catalogue for the relevant area.

children.heading: rule management application status
children.text: The METR distribution system shall provide its operational status and the status of transmission of each rule to an authorized manager upon request.

children.heading: Additional requirements
children.text: There are no additional requirements for localized dissemination.

attributesChanged.text: There are no additional requirements for the collection role of a translation system.
